intro: Petrorhagia prolifera subsp. nanteuilii, commonly known as the Nanteuil's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and Mediterranean climates.
